intro: Uvaria manubriata, commonly known as the African star fruit or wild star fruit, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a tangy, acidic flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and edible fruits make it both ecologically and economically significant in its native regions.
